summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing the handling of Touhy requests (requests for government information in third-party litigation) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails detail the process of responding to requests, coordinating with the Maxwell prosecution team, and navigating jurisdictional issues with other U.S. Attorney's Offices (S.D. Fla., N.D. Ga.). It reveals internal deliberations on document production and legal strategy.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: The primary point of contact for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims; drafts response letters and coordinates approvals.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Provides legal guidance and approval on Touhy request responses, discusses Giglio implications and jurisdictional issues.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: Cc'd on emails discussing Touhy request strategies and approvals.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Involved in coordinating with the civil division on Touhy requests, plans calls with victim's counsel, and is part of the 'Maxwell team'.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney for an Epstein victim making a Touhy request; referenced as counsel to be contacted.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified as a Jane Doe victim making a Touhy request; mentioned in context of grand jury subpoena and immunity discussions.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referenced as a 'wiser Touhy head' to be consulted on jurisdictional questions.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigations and civil litigation prompting the Touhy requests.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: Mentioned as someone John McEnany spoke to about designating Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: An AUSA to whom an initial Touhy request was made.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Referenced as the potentially 'responsible' U.S. Attorney if a district is subpoenaed.

connections.description: Frequent email correspondence where Kochevar seeks McEnany's approval and guidance on Touhy request responses.
Coordinate on handling Touhy requests, with Alex providing input from the criminal prosecution side.
McEnany loops Alex into discussions and designates coordination on Touhy matters.
Kaplan is identified as counsel for victim Maria Lacerda in her civil suit.
Kochevar corresponds with Kaplan as the government's point of contact for her client's Touhy request.
Alex plans to notify Kaplan about the Touhy process and expects further communication.
McEnany consulted with Jeffrey O about designating a Touhy point of contact.

events.title: Final Approval for Touhy Response
events.description: Email chain seeks final approval for a letter responding to an Epstein victim's Touhy request, confirming the Maxwell team has signed off.

events.title: Updated Touhy Response Letter
events.description: Kochevar circulates an updated response letter to a victim's Touhy request, approved by the Maxwell team.

events.title: Identification of Jane Doe as Maria Lacerda
events.description: McEnany confirms that a Jane Doe making a Touhy request is victim Maria Lacerda and approves production of a previously disclosed grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Process for Epstein Victims
events.description: Internal discussion establishes Steven Kochevar as the point person for Touhy requests from Epstein victims, with a plan to send a formal letter outlining the request process to attorney Roberta Kaplan.

keyFacts: The SDNY was handling formal Touhy requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein seeking government documents for use in civil litigation.
The prosecution team for Ghislaine Maxwell (the 'Maxwell team') was involved in reviewing and approving responses to these victim requests.

Internal emails reveal the government did not possess files from the U.S. Attorney's Office in S.D. Fla. regarding the earlier Epstein investigation, including materials on immunity discussions for victim Maria Lacerda.
Prosecutors noted that communications with victim's counsel under the Touhy process were likely disclosable as Giglio material (information affecting witness credibility).
There was internal debate about jurisdictional responsibility for Touhy requests related to the S.D. Fla. investigation, with N.D. Ga. having stepped into S.D. Fla.'s role for Epstein matters.
